metadata.description: Inspiration from BF4 test range, go as fast as you can.

Single-click bots travel in straight lines at various angles on an X/Y Plane, while making unpredictable directional changes and colliding with walls. The player's weapon has three shots and empty magazines recover per bullet.
One invincible thin bot makes long and short strafes in a three dimensional space at various frequencies with smooth transitions between them.
Bots move in slow horizontal lines in a rectangular prism at various depths and need to be tracked for a short period to be eliminated. Horizontal direction changes are very slow and predictable.

activities.scenarioName: VT Air Long Strafes Far Intermediate

scenario.description: Even smaller Micro distance flick training. Train the most consistent form of flicking at a target - micro flicking - which usually follows a bigger, more chunky flick.Try your best to hit each target consciously for maximal learning effect, even if having to go slow first (no self destruct of target).The faster you are, the higher you potentially can score - a target respawns instantly. Be aware that score is accuracy weighted! See also other flick distance related scenarios:  micro++ < micro < small < medium
Inspiration from BF4 test range, go as fast as you can. Static version, you have to click.
hanzo#3483
Air 2 far long strafes only for one minute
1w2t Smallflicks and voxTS had baby, and they named it beanTS,
It's flicktastic!
One invincible thin bot makes long and short strafes in a three dimensional space at various frequencies with smooth transitions between them.
250% Bot Speed
Tracking various strafe bots.The bots will attack.The player must avoid them. Robots.
Practice snapping to smaller than normal targets.
Target switch scenario based on Smoothbot. Humanoid targets.
Low pressure hitscan tracking against a hard to hit target.
Track the bot the best you can while long strafing.
modified map file to mitigate target size variance and offscreen flicks
Track the bots gliding through the sky towards you on invisible gliders.
Manage bombarding targets before they despawn or collide. A test of flick reflex, multitasking, and depth perception.
Horizontal target switching
1 click = 1 kill. Practice your precision on tiny targets. Good Luck!

Single-click bots travel in straight lines at various angles on an X/Y Plane, while making unpredictable directional changes and colliding with walls. The player's weapon has three shots and empty magazines recover per bullet.
Practice to microadjust on small targets.
A pure test of smoothness. You MUST use ADS (forced 103OW FoV) to prevent cheese. The glass on the sides give you time to react to bot strafes.

Not a challenge -- Set up targets as desired and walk to a comfortable distance to warm up with different zoom FOVs: 103 16MF9 = OW hip, 40 vML = Ashe, 30 vML = Widow/Ana, 90 4ML3 = CSGO hip, 45 4ML3 = AUG, 40 4ML3 = AWP, 15 4ML3 = scout doublezoom, 10 4ML3 = AWP doublezoom. Make sure you ADS to shoot, all weapons except 90 4ML3 shoot blanks in hipfire mode. Zoom FOV of 90 4ML3 is also adjustable.
Practice to do strafe aiming against stairs. The time limit extend 5 s on every kill. Target's strafe gradually become harder to aim (there are 10 levels). With Robots.
A strafing target despawns after 500 ms.
Close quarter combat against a long strafing bot. Keep moving for increased score.
Target switch scenario based on Smoothbot. Humanoid targets.
Track the long strafing target vertically and horizontally. Too easy?? Try the hardmode on the workshop
Medium sized bots spawn on the inner three walls within a rectangular prism, with every single click elimination reloading the player's three round magazine.
Great practice for flicking to many targets quickly.

Four single-click bots leap in mid-high arcs on top of a flat surface, changing depths as they traverse. The player's weapon has three shots and empty magazines recover in their entirety upon each elimination.
Small stationary bots spawn in random locations on an X/Y Plane, with each single click elimination reloading a single bullet.
Flick to a short-lived target before it despawns. A test of reflex and flick accuracy. Single 150 size target with 450 ms lifetime.
Track very thin targets that make long strafes, progressively getting harder. Challenge mode takes up to 2-3 minutes.
6 targets spawn on a wall.  Great practice for flicking to many targets quickly.  Challenge mode has accuracy-based scoring.
Low FoV target switch with decent range and smallish targets. Targets aren't moving. Good to practice switching speed.
Micro Flick / Short Flick distance training. target lifetime: 250ms. Adjustments: increased map depth (8192 units), increased spawn area padding
tile frenzy 180
FuglaaXY but mostly vertical (easy)

Practice to recognize a movement direction of a target quickly. A target begins to move when you hit it (lifetime: 500 ms).   ---------------------------------- Note: MCA stands for "Midweek Competitive Aiming", a local event for the competitive aiming community in Japan.
Close Fast Strafes, but the bots are invincible
1wall 2targets small, except accuracy isn't factored into score; instead, you have ammo that reloads on kill.
3 Small Targets, Small ROM, Static.
modified map file to mitigate target size variance and offscreen flicks.
One invincible spherical bot makes tall and fast leaps around the player, while changing direction at either the apex of its jump or at the end of its descent.
Spherical bots make slow horizontal movements, occasionally changing height levels and direction. Each bot needs to be tracked for a short period to be eliminated.
1wall 4targets small, except accuracy isn't factored into score; instead, you have ammo that reloads on kill. Added 103 FOV minimum.
It's flicktastic!
Flick to a short-lived target before it despawns. A test of reflex and flick accuracy. Single 200 size target with 500 ms lifetime.
Target Switching 360, but the bots are static
For all your relaa fans, a scenario to train target switching
